thread.title: Beaver residents warned of phone scams
thread.title_full: Beaver residents warned of phone scams

author: kkennedy@timesonline.com(Kirstin Kennedy)
title: Beaver residents warned of phone scams
text:
Beaver residents warned of phone scams Staff reports Timesonline.com | 0 comments 
BEAVER -- Borough officials are warning residents after a series of phony IRS collection calls have been reported. 
The calls placed to local households are done so under the guise of an IRS worker and have contained threats of arrest and imprisonment, according to a statement released by Beaver officials. The IRS does not make such calls, and it does not contact residents over the phone with threats of arrest. 
Officials are also warning of a phone scheme targeting wireless phone users. These calls often disconnect after one ring, not giving the consumer time to answer the call and tempting them to call back. If a call like this is received, residents are encouraged not to call back. 
Complaints can be filed through the Federal Communications Commission at www.fcc.gov/complaints or by calling 888-225-5322.
